fields.description:
h3. Summary Creating users via POST to the {{/rest/api/2/user}} endpoint will intermittently throw a 500 error and even with a 500 response from this endpoint, the user is successfully created and visible in the UI. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Using the script below (Atlassian staff only) to create users from a CSV file # Most of the time, a 201 response is received but occasionally a 500 response is received and the user is still successfully created h3. Expected Results User created with a 201 HTTP response. h3. Actual Results Out of 100, 80 users are created with a 201 response and 20 with a 500. {code}500 Atlassian Cloud Notifications - Page Unavailable

Page unavailable

Please check Atlassian Status for any known issues.
If your page hasn't appeared again in 5-10 minutes, please contact our support team.

Atlassian Status   Contact support

  • Atlassian Status
  • Release Summary
  • Documentation
  • Answers
Atlassian
{code}
fields.summary: rest/api/2/user throwing 500 error intermittently

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Creating an issue through REST API without setting required fields throws a misleading error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set Description field to "required"
# run
{code:java}
curl -vvv -u email@email.com -k -X POST -H "Accept: application/json" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"fields": { "reporter":{ "name": "test" }, "issuetype":{ "name": "Cloud Support" }, "project":{ "key": "XXX" }, "summary": "Testing"} }' "https://instance.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue"
{code}

h3. Expected Results

It should throw an error informing that Description field is required
h3. Actual Results

It throws
{code:java}
{"errorMessages":[],"errors":{"summary":"Field 'summary' cannot be set. It is not on the appropriate screen, or unknown.","reporter":"Field 'reporter' cannot be set. It is not on the appropriate screen, or unknown."}}
{code}
*Application logs:*
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Misleading error while creating issue using REST API

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the The Burndown Release Chart shows the issue grouped in Sprints based on the time when there was Sprint running on this board. If there were parallel Sprints, the issues show as part of the Sprint during the time the issues were completed, which leads to wrong conclusion that the issues are part of this Sprint. 

h3. Suggested Solution
The Release Burndown report should not show Sprint that contains no issues on the board even if it was created on this board, OR
Add information in the Burndown Chart that explains this behaviour.
fields.summary: The Release Burndown report should not show Sprint that contains no issues on the board even if it was created on this board

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Searches that includes custom fields have no results.
Also ordering search results by custom fields have no effect.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run {{your_custom_field = existing_value}}
 # Run {{your_custom_field is EMPTY}}
 # Run {{your_custom_field is not EMPTY}}
 # Run {{order by your_custom_field}}

h3. Expected Results

Searches should return the corresponding issues.
h3. Actual Results

No result is returned
h3. Workaround
 # Go to custom fields page.
 # Click on the cog next to the custom field > _Configure._
 # Edit the context > save the changes.
 # Change back the settings of the context > save the changes.

In case this won't work, please open a support request in [support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com] and we will fix this for you.
fields.summary: Searches that includes custom fields have no results

fields.description: Currently the JIRA Cloud REST API has a [variable maxResults|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/changing-maxresults-parameter-for-jira-rest-api-779160706.html] and this is affecting users by generating a lot of extra work to compile all the results.
fields.summary: JIRA Cloud REST API increase the limit for maxResults

fields.description:
Currently, when you associate a project with an [Issue Security Scheme|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-issue-level-security-776636711.html], JIRA will stop sending notifications to Slack.  

This behavior is intended in order to avoid any sensitive data for being shared on a Slack room without having the previous consent of a JIRA administrator. 

As a JIRA administrator, I'd like to have a way on the integration UI to approve the sharing of this content on a specific Slack channel of my choice.
fields.summary: JIRA for Slack integration: Make it possible to receive notifications from issues secured by issue security schemes

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In Jira Cloud, in order to calculate durations, we are asking our users to use a text field. It is hard to validate the values before the user saves.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a new field type Duration that displays time duration like the Jira time tracking field format.
fields.summary: Duration Custom Field Type

fields.description:
When we change an agility project's name, their respective agility board keep the old name of the project.

We understand that this feature can be achieved on a Kanban Board, however, we would like to be able to use this simple feature as it is being able to change only the name of the board or at least update it when changing the respective project's name.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The wallboard is displaying only two gadgets at once. Only one row of gadgets is rendered.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a dashboard with multiple gadgets, preferably with more than one gadget in each column.
# Select the option 'View as wallboard'

h3. Expected Results
Depending on the layout, at least two gadgets should be displayed on each column and if it's suitable, the gadgets should be rendered in another row.

h3. Actual Results
Only two gadgets are displayed at once in a row.

h3. Notes
- The documentation shows as if it was possible to display several gadgets at once. However, regardless the chosen layout, only two gadgets are rendered.
- The Wallboard documentation: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/displaying-a-dashboard-as-a-wallboard-720416968.html

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: The Wallboard is displaying only two gadgets at once.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When loading a big image by using Introduction Gadget, the image cannot be loaded properly for the first time unless we click on Gadget Settings > Maximize, and then refresh the page. However, after logging out and relogging back in, the same issue will happen again where we need to click on Gadget Settings > Maximize, and then refresh the page. This is likely due to cache issue

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a test dashboard and put Introduction Gadget to the dashboard
# Use Introduction Gadget to display a big image
# Go to the dashboard
# The image will not be loaded properly
# Go to Gadget Settings > Maximize then refresh the page
# The image will be loaded properly now
# Logout and login back and go to the test dashboard

h3. Expected Results
The image can be viewed successfully

h3. Actual Results
The image cannot be loaded successfully. We need to click on Gadget Settings > Maximize then refresh the page again. Please see the screenshot
fields.summary: Introduction Gadget does not stay maximized after logout and relogin

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using REST API to upload issue attachment {{POST /rest/api/2/issue/\{issueIdOrKey}/attachments}} may result in {{413 Entity too large}} response, even if it is allowed to have bigger uploads. However later on the attachment can be seen as attached to the issue.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # use REST API endpoint to upload an attachment to a Jira issue: {{POST /rest/api/2/issue/\{issueIdOrKey}/attachments}}
 # select a file that is _large_ - usually the bug affects files larger than 120MB, but there is no precise size threshold.
 # make sure that file size does not exceed the attachment size allowed for the instance.

h3. Expected Results
 # REST API response is {{200 OK}} including representation of attached file in the response body.
 # File is successfully attached to the issue.

h3. Actual Results
 # REST API response is {{413 Entity too large}}
 # File is *successfully attached* to the issue.

h3. Workaround

After receiving the {{413 Entity too large}} response to attachment upload request, use {{GET /rest/api/2/issue/\{issueIdOrKey}}} endpoint to fetch issue details and confirm whether the file was attached, together with the attachment details.
fields.summary: REST API 413 entity too large for POST /rest/api/2/issue/{issueIdOrKey}/attachments

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When an issue is assigned to a user during a transition and, a user(may/may not be the same user) is @mentioned, Jira will trigger duplicate email notifications for a single @mention event.  

Example:
* Emails received(local timezone GMT+2):
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-08 at 8.38.32 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Jira application logs(local timezone GMT+0) - notice how Jira is generating the same email twice:
{noformat}
2017-10-08 18:33:03.941	Email was sent with Message-Id <1187991085.251272.1507487583677@72a1ae8bd9ca> (details="To='[recipient email address]' Subject='Derrick Nguyen mentioned you on BP-37 (JIRA) ' From='null' FromName='[sender email address]' Cc='null' Bcc='null' ReplyTo='null' InReplyTo='null' MimeType='text/html' Encoding='UTF-8' Multipart='javax.mail.internet.MimeMultipart@71b47aac' MessageId='<1187991085.251272.1507487583677@72a1ae8bd9ca>' ExcludeSubjectPrefix=false'")
2017-10-08 18:33:03.700	Email was sent with Message-Id <276773807.251446.1507487583504@6958851ca923> (details="To='[recipient email address]' Subject='Derrick Nguyen mentioned you on BP-37 (JIRA) ' From='null' FromName='[sender email address]' Cc='null' Bcc='null' ReplyTo='null' InReplyTo='null' MimeType='text/html' Encoding='UTF-8' Multipart='javax.mail.internet.MimeMultipart@60de2ac' MessageId='<276773807.251446.1507487583504@6958851ca923>' ExcludeSubjectPrefix=false'")
{noformat}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Scenario:
* Workflow transition uses a screen
* The screen that is used contains the "Assignee" field
* The screen must also contain a comment field

Example(Resolution field does not affect the results):
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-08 at 8.48.30 PM.png|thumbnail! 

# Create a new issue
# Transition the issue
# On the transition screen, assign the issue to a user and @mention another user(as per the example screen above)

h3. Expected Results
* Only a single email is triggered to the @mentioned user

h3. Actual Results
* 2 x emails are triggered by the one event
 
h3. Notes
* The issue must be Assigned from the transition screen in order to re-create this bug
* The issue can be assigned to any user and any user can be @mentioned
* Being/not being a Watcher on the issue doesn't make any difference

h3.Workaround
* No known workarounds
fields.summary: Duplicate emails are triggered when a user is @mentioned

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The "User Picker (multiple users)" custom field is not expandable under certain conditions.  The length of the specified users' full names and resolution of the user's computer display seems to determine whether or not the custom field is expandable.  This is an issue because it's not clear which users are specified if there are more than 2 users in the custom field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new  "User Picker (multiple users)" custom field and assign the new field to a screen.
# Create a new issue and add at least 3 users to the newly created custom field.
# Ensure that the 2nd user's name is equal or less than ~7 characters in length(including space)
# Check the resolution of the computer screen - this will change how the field is presented

h3. Expected Results
* The custom field("multi user picker") should be expandable so that users are able to reveal all specified values within the custom field.  The field shows a single user with 2 more values present in the field.
 !Andrew A_Bob Bob_1280x768.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Actual Results
* The table below shows the same issue("multi user picker") but displayed with different screen resolutions.  There are 3("Andrew A", "Bob Bob", "Charlie C") users in the "multi user picker" field.
||1366x768||1280x768||
| !Andrew A_Bob Bob_1366x768.png|thumbnail! | !Andrew A_Bob Bob_1280x768.png|thumbnail! |

* The length of the user's full name affects how the "multi user picker" behaves.  In this example, the 2nd user's name was changed from "Bob Bob" to "Bob Bobby1".  Users with a full name of equal or more than 7 characters are not affected by this bug, but testing has shown that users with excessively long names are affected.
||1366x768||1280x768||
| !Andrew A_Bob Bobby1_1366x768.png|thumbnail! | !Andrew A_Bob Bobby1_1280x768.png|thumbnail! |


h3. Notes
* Resolution that the user is using to view Jira affects how this field is displayed.  This condition is reproduced differently on different resolutions depending on the character count on the second user's full name("Bob Bob" in this example).
* Full names without spaces seem to allow the "User Picker (multiple users)" field to be expandable as expected.
* This problem is not limited to 1366x768 and 1280x768, higher resolutions are reported to cause the problem, but we were unable to get consistent results while testing.
* Possible that aspect ratio has more to do with how the custom field is rendered rather than resolution.
* Issue affects multiple browsers and has been tested on OS X Sierra and Windows 10.
* Resizing the browser window makes no difference.

h3.Workaround
* Editing the field allows the field to be expandable until the page is refreshed.
|| 1 || 2 || 3 ||
| !Andrew A_Bob Bob_1366x768_edit.png|thumbnail! | !Andrew A_Bob Bob_1366x768_edit_1.png|thumbnail! |!Andrew A_Bob Bob_1280x768_edit_2.png|thumbnail! |
fields.summary: "User Picker (multiple users)" custom field is not expandable

fields.description:
h3. Summary

A issue (Parent) that had Sub-tasks converted to standard issue (task, bug, etc) are keeping the information of parent in the "denormalised_subtask_parent" column. When try to delete the parent issue or a project that has one issue in this situation JIRA get stuck and didn't proceed with the delete.
We have this error in logs:
{code:java}
    msg: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: Exception while deleting the following entity: [GenericEntity:Issue][id,10075] (SQL Exception while executing the following:DELETE FROM public.jiraissue WHERE ID=? (ERROR: update or delete on table "jiraissue" violates foreign key constraint "jiraissue_denormalised_subtask_parent_fkey" on table "jiraissue"
  Detail: Key (id)=(10075) is still referenced from table "jiraissue".))    
     stack: com.atlassian.jira.exception.RemoveException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: Exception while deleting the following entity: [GenericEntity:Issue][id,10075] (SQL Exception while executing the following:DELETE FROM public.jiraissue WHERE ID=? (ERROR: update or delete on table "jiraissue" violates foreign key constraint "jiraissue_denormalised_subtask_parent_fkey" on table "jiraissue"
  Detail: Key (id)=(10075) is still referenced from table "jiraissue".))
{code}
Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a issue
 # Create a subtask for that issue
 # Convert this subtask to standart issue type (bug, improvement, task)
 # try to delete the parent issue (or delte the project)

h3. Expected Results

The issue will be corrected delete
h3. Actual Results

JIRA get stuck, the issue is not deleted. Also, the project is not delete.
h3. Notes

No error is shown on the UI, only in the logs
h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Unable to delete issue for violates foreign key constraint

fields.description:

Please, remove the the blue box at the top of the page that instructs customers to contact Cloud support to perform this procedure.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Jira does not have a Notification Panel or any other means to inform about notifications without accessing a mailbox.

h3. Suggested Solution
Similar to Confluence, enable a Notification Panel in Jira:
!notifications-panel.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Why this is important
Currently, you can only be aware of Jira notifications checking your email, or switching to Confluence, if available.
Having a feature to keep track of the notifications without relying on emails can be very useful for some customers.

h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Enable a notification panel in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the new Jira experience, there is a scrollbar blocking the left side menu.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Opt-in to new Jira experience.
# Increase the zoom to more than 100%

h3. Expected Results
The zoom would just enlarge the icons and text.

h3. Actual Results
The more you zoom in, larger is the scrollbar blocking the left side menu.
- While zoom is on 90%:
 !zoom-90.png|thumbnail! 
- While zoom is on 110%:
 !zoom-110.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
- The problem also occurs on different browsers - Tested on Firefox, but it depends on the resolution and the size of the screen.
- The size of the left bar also depends on the resolution of the screen - in certain cases the scrollbar severely blocks the icons:
 !example.png|thumbnail! 
h3.Workaround
Zoom out to reduce the size of the scrollbar, or temporarily opt-out from new Jira experience.
fields.summary: In the new Jira experience, there is a scrollbar blocking the left side menu

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When applying a property key to a status, the property key should only apply on the workflow and status where the property key is set.  Property key settings are not scoped correctly, and property key settings are unintentionally applying to other workflows.

Scenario:
* A workflow scheme exists where there are multiple workflows assigned to different issue types
* Each of the workflows use the same 1st transition status("Status 1")
* The workflow scheme is assigned to a project

||Test Workflow Scheme||
| !TestWorkflowScheme.png|thumbnail! |

||Workflows||Assigned Issue Types||Diagram||
|Workflow 1| Task, Sub-task| !Workflow_1.png|thumbnail!  |
|Workflow 2| Bug| !Workflow_2.png|thumbnail!  |

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit Workflow 1
# Click on "Status 1" > Properties
# Specify a property key and value.  As an example, we will use the property key "jira.permission.comment.denied"(value=NULL)
|Workflow 1 > Status 1| !Workflow_1_Status_1.png|thumbnail!  |
|Workflow 2 > Status 1(left unchanged)|  !Workflow 2_Status_1.png|thumbnail! |
# Publish the workflow
# Create a bug and a task
# Transition to "Status 1" on both issues

h3. Expected Results
* Comments are not allowed on tasks while in the "Status 1" status
* Comments are allowed on bug issues while in the "Status 1" status

h3. Actual Results
* Unable to comment on a bug issue even though there isn't a property key restricting "Status 1" on "Workflow 2"
||Bug Issue || Task ||
| !Bug_Status_1.png|thumbnail! | !Task_Status_1.png|thumbnail! |
 
h3. Notes
* Adding the property key to "Workflow 2" instead of "Workflow 1" will produce the desired result 
* Keeping to the scenario mentioned in the summary, when using "Workflow 1" on another project, the property key does not apply to issues on the other project
* Scope of the property key is limited to the project - property key doesn't affect "Workflow 1" when used on another project
* Multiple property keys are affected

h3.Workaround
* No known workarounds
fields.summary: Status property key unintentionally applies to multiple workflows

fields.description:
h3. When:
When a custom field is populated on a workflow transition screen, its value is not searchable using JQL. This *does not* include the issue creation screen. Querying for *<Custom Field> is not empty* will return the issue, but querying for the value itself won't.

h3. How to replicate:
 # Create a custom field
 # Add it to a screen
 # Associate this screen with a workflow transition 
 # Create an issue *without* populating this field
 # Transition issue (populate the field)
 # Query for the field value

h3. Expected Results:
 * Issue will be returned

h3. Actual Results:
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-06 at 3.47.18 PM.png|thumbnail! 
{code}
No issues were found to match your search
Try modifying your search criteria or creating a new issue
{code}

h3. Issue Info:
 * When querying for this field on the database, it is possible to see that it is properly populated
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-06 at 3.45.59 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround:
 * Editing custom field value manually makes it searchable once again
 * Setting custom field on issue creation screen (if applicable) also works.
fields.summary: Custom field value set on workflow transition screen is not searchable

fields.description:
How much information should be given and how much noise Jirabot makes seems to be an issue. Using Jirabot pretty much guarantees that your channel will drown in information. 
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-66702

As the information may or may not be relevant to other parties, it makes sense to use slack threads so that "What is posted" is not in contention, since "Where it is" is unobtrusive.
fields.summary: Jirabot - Use slack threads to post issues.

Have the option to share attachments added to linked issues.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

On the new Issue detail view feature there's no option to restrict a comment access:
 !new.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Implement the functionality that is already present on the old issue detail view:

Many times users need to leave comments that should be restricted to a group of users and right now that's not possible.

fields.summary: Ability to create users via REST without sending invitation emails.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While searching for a numeric string, stored in a "Text" (single line or multi-line) custom field, no result will be found if the value isn't parsed between double quotes.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a single line custom field (e.g. "Text Field") and associate it with a project. 
# Create an issue and set the text value to a numeric string. E.g. 9999
# Go to the issue navigator and perform the following query: 
{code}"Text Field" ~ 9999{code}

h3. Expected Results

The recently created issue should be retrieved.

h3. Actual Results

JIRA Finds no issues.

h3. Notes 

This happens only to numeric strings. If an issue has the "Text Field" value as an alphabetical string, JIRA will be able to query for the value without parsing it between double quotes.

The query below will retrieve the correct results:

{code}"Text Field" ~ Atlassian{code}  

h3.Workaround

Parse the numeric string between double quotes: 

{code}"Text Field" ~ "9999"{code}
fields.summary: Searching for numeric strings in Text custom fields won't retrieve issues

fields.summary: create a new user

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When specifying workflow transition properties, none of the property key and value combinations seem to work.  The same property key values and combinations seem to work when applied to a status, but not on the transition.

Examples:
In this example, we would like to restrict the permissions so only members of the "administrators" group are able to be assigned to an issue.  In this case, the "administrators" group only contains 1 member.
||Method used to set a property key || Setting the property key || Result ||
|Workflow > "Start Progress" transition > Properties|!Screen Shot 2017-10-05 at 11.25.49 AM.png|thumbnail!| !Screen Shot 2017-10-05 at 11.27.09 AM.png|thumbnail! |
|Workflow > "In Progress" status > Properties| !Screen Shot 2017-10-05 at 11.36.34 AM.png|thumbnail!| !Screen Shot 2017-10-05 at 11.38.19 AM.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a workflow
# Select a transition > properties
# Add a property key(e.g. 'jira.permission.assignable.group'; key='administrators')
# Test for the desired behavior

h3. Expected Results
* In this example, we expect that only "administrators" group members are able to be assigned to the issue and commenting should be disabled.

h3. Actual Results
* In this example, when the property keys and values are added to the transition, then nothing happens - no changes.  The user is able to assign any Jira account to the issue from the transition screen.
 
h3. Notes
* Initial tests have shown that other property keys are affected.

h3.Workaround
* In some cases, applying the desired property keys and values on statues may be a viable workaround.
fields.summary: Workflow transition properties are not working

fields.description:
Currently, I can create only one subscription per project.

It would be very useful to be able create more than one. This allows me to set up multiple conditions, for example, if I want to be notified when a) any issue is closed, and b) when blockers are created, I can create two subscriptions like this:

Subscription 1: Type <All>, Priority <All>, Issue Transitioned to <Closed>

Subscription 2: Type <All>, Priority <Blocker>, Issue Created

With the current approach, I have to choose one or the other of the above – there is no way to have both.
fields.summary: Multiple Slack @JiraBot subscriptions to the same project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a large number of 'Working hours per day' and 'Working days per week' configured, data overflows when JIRA multiplies hours per day with days per week. This is caused by JRACLOUD-67684.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create some issues with large number of estimates like 365d, 100w, etc
# Go to *Administrations > Issues > Time Tracking*
# Click on *Edit global settings*
# *Working hours per day:* 100000 or larger
# *Working days per week:* 99999 or larger
# *Save*
# Refresh the page
 
h3. Expected Results
An error message is prompted that invalid value has entered for 'Working hours per day' and 'Working days per week'.

h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On Time Tracking Configuration, it allows saving >24 hrs for 'Working hours per day' and >7 days for 'Working days per week'.
h3. Customer Impact

It could cause data overflow. See JRACLOUD-67685.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to *Administrations > Issues > Time Tracking*
 # Click on *Edit global settings*
 # *Working hours per day:* 100
 # *Working days per week:* 100
 # *Save*

h3. Expected Results

An error message is prompted that invalid value has entered for 'Working hours per day' and 'Working days per week'.
h3. Actual Results

Value is saved.
fields.summary: Time Tracking Allows Saving Invalid 'Working hours per day' and 'Working days per week'

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It's not possible to set password for users upon creation via POST request to the endpoint {{/rest/api/2/user}} despite our documentation saying that it is. In addition, it says that in case a password is not provided in the request, one will be set randomly, which is not true from what I was able to test.
{quote}Create user. By default created user will not be notified with email. If password field is not set then password will be randomly generated.{quote}
Doc reference: https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/user-createUser

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Run the following cURL to create a sample user:
{code}curl -D- -u <email_address> -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X POST -d '{"displayName":"Name Here", "emailAddress":"email@here.com", "name":"username_here", "password":"12345678"}' https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user{code}

h3. Expected Results
Atlassian Account is created with password provided.

h3. Actual Results
Atlassian Account is created not taking into consideration the password provided.
fields.summary: POST /rest/api/2/user does not set a password if provided nor does it set one randomly if not.

fields.description: JIRA Pie Chart not showing labels unless you hover, then only one at a time. I would like consistent labels as shown in the screen shot below (without having to hover to see percentage/title)
fields.summary: JIRA Pie Chart Lables

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A POST request to create user via REST API endpoint {{/rest/api/2/user}} will trigger an email notification, despite our documentation says:
{quote}Create user. By default created user will not be notified with email. If password field is not set then password will be randomly generated.{quote}
Doc reference: https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/user-createUser

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Run the following cURL to create a sample user:
{code}curl -D- -u <email_address> -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X POST -d '{"displayName":"Name Here", "emailAddress":"email@here.com", "name":"username-here"}' https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user{code}

h3. Expected Results
User is created without triggering notification.

h3. Actual Results
The user is created and a notification is triggered.
fields.summary: POST /rest/api/2/user triggering email notification

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When verifying the SPF record provided to the end user, if the dns records for SPF is over 255 characters the internal verification tool cuts it off and does not verify.

Per https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4408#section-3.1.3  We should be compliant with this and take over 255 characters.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a SPF record greater than 255 characters to a domain, including the Atlassian SPF record.
# Try and verify utilizing the SPF/DKIM internal checker or through the instances project email settings.

h3. Expected Results
SPF record is confirmed.
h3. Actual Results
SPF record cannot be verified.
h3.Workaround
Add SPF records on different lines in your DNS configuration.  I.E. splitting in two separate records.
fields.summary: SPF Records that are over 255 Characters are not able to verify their domain.

fields.description: Having the ability to designate a user outside of the administrator of the JIRA Cloud instance to import more than 250 rows with CSV's would reduce the load on the JIRA Administrator significantly.
fields.summary: Allow more than 250 csv rows to be imported by specified users outside of the administrator.

fields.description:
h2. Problem Statement

Currently there is no written documentation about how to achieve specific task in JIRA mobile (like publishing the differences between clicking and using shortcut keys), i.e. for each feature in the docs, there should be an explaination on how to do a task via the web interface using clicks, and then using shortcuts, you could explain how it is done on Android and on IOS and, if not possible on those apps, then make that fact explicit. The users are often unaware how to do specific task in JIRA mobile apps, for example, how to create a sub-task inside a story; without knowing that it is not possible / it is a new feature.

h2. Proposed Solution

It will be good if there is official documentation / user guides written for JIRA mobile
fields.summary: Update JIRA documentation on the differences between JIRA cloud and JIRA mobile apps

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Pagination on Jira dashboard gadgets are shown as " 1-2 of 2" for a list of 2 items.  This should be changed to something that cannot be misinterpreted in other languages or is not grammatically correct in other languages.


h3. Suggested Solution
* Allow users to change how pagination is represented
* Standardise on "1-2/2" to represent 1-2 of 2.

h3. Why this is important
* When translated into other languages displaying "1-2 of 2" may not be grammatically correct

h3. Workaround 
* No known workarounds
fields.summary: Change how pagination on dashboard gadgets a represented

{code}

We can get this error when the database the jira backup is exported from has a wider issue summary column than we accept (255 characters). When we try to insert the summary into its column in the database it will fail to insert because it is too long, thus causing the import to fail.

*Workaround*
Manually look through the entities.xml and fix the issues summary data to be shorter than 255 characters long. Typically people will truncate this but another option is to also move the content to the description field.

*Other*
In the general case there's not a lot we can do for this type of issue, but in this specific case I think there's an argument to be made to:
* copy the summary into the description field (if present); and 
* truncate the summary; but
* fail the import if we can't do those things.
fields.summary: Issues with long summaries prevent imports

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating a new project, sometimes, depending on the template, the workflow may be created as in 'project' scope only. In this case, if we delete the project and try to create a new one using the same project key, it will fail with this error:
{code}
Hmm... we couldn't create your project due to an unknown error. Try refreshing the page to start again.
{code}

This is because, when the project is created the first time, a Workflow Scheme will be created with a default name. If the project key is TEST, it may be this (if it's software):
{code}
TEST: Software Simplified Workflow Scheme
{code}

If we delete project TEST, the Workflow and Scheme will not be deleted and when trying to recreate the project, it will try to re-use the Workflow Scheme with its Workflow.

If the Workflow and Workflow Scheme had a 'project' scope, this will fail, as JIRA is expecting a global project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project using the 'Agility' template (say, with key TEST)
# Check that a Workflow with 'project' scope is created
# Delete the project
# Try to create a new project with same key

h3. Expected Results
Since key is no longer used, project is created correctly.

Project creation fails with error in UI mentioned above and this in logs:

None.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The "Begin Import" button is fade out if there is space in the email box in the Trello Import wizard


h3. Environment
Atlassian Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to External Import and choose Trello
# Try to import any Board from Trello
# Enter the emails > Add space at the end of some email 

h3. Expected Results
The *Begin Import* Button is available

h3. Actual Results
The *Begin Import* Button is fade out
*  !Begin Import trello.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
Make sure there aren't any spaces while importing the emails.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Calendar gadget on dashboard highlights yesterday's date on beginning of the day. Automatically switches to correct date around mid-day.

 
h3. Customer Impact

Creating confusion for customers and may lead to more problems.
h3. Environment *
h5. JIRA v1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new dashboard or use an existing one
 # place a calendar gadget on dashboard
 # Save 
 # Try showing the gadget early in the morning. Highlights yesterday's date

h3. Expected Results

Calendar should highlight today's date whenever viewed.
h3. Actual Results

Calendar shows yesterday's date. Automatically shows correct date after mid-day.
h3. Notes

This is due to the current date being calculated by the server, which uses GMT, with no regard for the timezone of the current user. If the user's timezone is ahead of GMT (e.g. Sydney) then the user observes the calendar highlighting yesterday's date until GMT clicks over to the next day.

If the user's timezone is behind GMT, then the user would observe the calendar highlighting tomorrow's date when GMT clicks over to the next day.
h3. Workaround  

No workaround as of now.
fields.summary: Calendar gadget on Dashboard highlights yesterday's date

fields.description:

# Go to any project

fields.description:
We're seeing _invalid byte sequence for encoding "UTF8": 0x00_ errors during import again.


h3. Workaround

Running the following command over the {{entities.xml}} file from the backup and re-archiving it results in being able to import the data in JIRA: 
{code}perl -pi -e 's/\x00//g' entities.xml{code}
fields.summary: 0x00 import errors again

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*Atlassian Update, May 9th, 2019:*

Hello everyone,

This bug is fixed and released in Jira cloud. Now, a Create Version button will be permanently visible on top of the version list. You can add a new version without waiting for all versions to load on the screen.

Thanks,
Jira cloud product management

 
{panel}

h3. Summary

On the project that contains a huge history of releases, the user is forced to scroll down the release page before having the option to add a new release.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add 50+ releases to a project
# Turn on the new JIRA experience
# Load the release page and try to add a new release


h3. Expected Results

The add release form should be available on the screen.

h3. Actual Results

The add release form is locked down at the bottom of the list. Each time the user scrolls down, the remaining release versions are loaded on the page and the add release form keeps moving. Once all the release versions are loaded on the page, the add release form is available for the customer.
fields.summary: Cannot add a new release until all release versions are loaded in the screen

h3. Summary
JIRA notifications/filters subscriptions are delayed.

h3. Environment
* JIRA v1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# The user who should be notified will receive the message hours later

or

h3. Expected Results

or

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Notifications to Slack aren't being triggered when [custom events|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/custom-events-868983028.html] are associated with workflow steps.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom event as detailed on this documentation page: [Adding a custom event|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/adding-a-custom-event-776636672.html]
# Edit a transition to trigger the custom event, rather than the Generic Event, as follows:
{code}
Fire a <your custom Event here> event that can be processed by the listeners. 
{code}
# Setup the Slack integration to fire when an issue is transitioned to the workflow transition associated with the custom event 
# Transition the issue
# A notification will not be received in Slack

h3. Expected Results
Custom events should be triggering a notification to Slack just like system events.

h3. Actual Results
Workflow steps associated with custom events are not triggering a notification to Slack.

h3.Workaround
The only workaround available is to setup the post function to use a system event, but this could have a negative impact (limit functionality) on the notification scheme if it's based on custom events.
fields.summary: Slack integration isn't listening to custom events associated with workflow transitions

h3. Summary

 After performing an import from another instance, the incoming mail servers are not imported as expected.
 
h3. Environment
- Cloud to Cloud migration
- Server to Cloud migration

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On instance A, create some custom incoming mail servers
# Generate a backup
# Import the data to instance B

h3. Expected Results
The configurations of incoming mail servers on instance B should be the same as instance A.

h3. Actual Results
The incoming mail servers are imported but with NULL data:
!image.png|thumbnail!

_Application logs:_
Logs showed the import was done successfully (no error logs).

h3.Workaround

fields.description:
I want to refer to [this KB article on Boards in the new JIRA experience|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/boards-in-the-new-jira-experience-937886048.html] which has the following statement in it:
{quote}Previously, there were global boards that contained work from multiple projects. Those are a thing of the past.

Since boards now have their own location, the sidebar displays options relating to the project that contains the board. Even if your board contains issues from several projects, the sidebar remains project-centric, giving you quick, navigation to the work related to your project and board.
{quote}
This is not how we use JIRA Software. And many of our customers don't either. Many of our customers support multiple external organisations and have set up JIRA Projects per customer. Other companies have multiple Jira projects per application they support, but share teams and other resources across, so they need a common view on this backlog.

Our own consultancy team has a shared board to manage the backlog of 50+ projects. How could we possible associate this with "a project"? Or with a user profile?

Our key boards are not project centric at all, but team centric. And these key boards are our primary place to go to in Jira.

So, global team boards should be prominent, easy to find and definitely not 'a thing from the past'
fields.summary: Boards in the new Jira Cloud experience should retain cross-project capabilities and should stay easily accessible

I want to be able to select a set of the issues shown in "Issues in this Epic" for bulk-editing,

So I don't have to go to each of them manually.

Bonus points for allowing the bulk-edit to happen in a modal window over the Epic screen, and not in a new bulk-edit window.
fields.summary: Bulk-Edit items in Epic Issue List

fields.description:
As a user editing/viewing an Epic,

I want to be able to drag-drop the issues shown in the "Issues in this Epic" list,

so I can stack-rank them in priority order.
fields.summary: Allow rank re-ordering in Epic issues list

fields.description:
I just used your new create user interface and it has poor usability. It asks for emails, so I put in an email [name@example.org.|mailto:name@example.org.] This becomes the full user name of the new user! Worse, that field is not editable!! Please go back to previous form where one could enter the full name in a separate field. At a minimum, provide on-screen help indicating that the full username will be drawn from the user's email, and, if it is true, that emails in the form of "firstname lastname <name@example.org>" are allowed and will result in full name being firstname lastname.

Very disappointing to see such degradation in usability / functionality on what was supposed to be an upgrade.
fields.summary: Edit full user name

JIRA Cloud

fields.summary: Attaching Files Fails: 403 Files Were Not in Appropriate Collection

fields.description:
Throughout the UI, "Release" and "Version" appear interchangeable. In fact, on the Releases screen, there's a button, "Merge Versions". And to add a new "Release" you enter its name in the "Version Name" box.

Which is it? Release or Version? It should be consistent.

As comparison, the other tools I use (VSTS, Aha!) allow you to set the terminology for a given item, and then that term is used consistently across the UX.
fields.summary: Inconsistent Terminology - "Release" and "Version" appear interchangeable

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like to have a feature that would allow the creation of issues when using the [JIRA Cloud for Slack (Official)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.slack/cloud/overview] integration. 

Currently, the integration has the following features available:
 * Notifications
 * Issues preview

I would like to have an additional command available that I could use to create issues from within a Slack channel. For example: 

{code}
 /jira create project:dev summary:’my epic’ description:’this is my epic’
{code}
fields.summary: I'd like to create JIRA issues from within the JIRA for Slack Integration

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Permissions not working as expected for default members of Project Roles.

h3. Customer Impact

h3. Environment


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Cog > System > Project Roles
# Create a new project role and add a user as a default member
# Grant permission to this new project role in a project, let's say Browse Project permission for example. (The issue applies to any kind of permission)

h3. Expected Results
As soon as you grant permission to the project role in a project, the default users should be able to access it.

h3. Actual Results

The default users of the project role still don't have the permission granted to the role.

*Application logs:*

h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
Inside the project settings, go to People and add the users to the project roles
fields.summary: Permissions not working as expected for default members on Project Roles

fields.description:
Customer's feedback:
{quote}After pressing the plus button(Create) in the main JIRA page, when I hover over the issue entry in the list, I see a hint for the keyboard shortcut. This shortcut is translated to German in a silly way. You may (dictionary-)translate "press" with "Presse" in German, but then it means media, newspapers, etc.
 
 If you mean the action of applying force on a button, you have to write "Drück" or "Drücke". Both are possible ([http://www.duden.de/rechtschreibung/druecken#block-duden-tiles-6\|http://www.duden.de/rechtschreibung/druecken#block-duden-tiles-6]). Since the German localization is quite formal, it has to be "Drücken Sie", I guess.
{quote} - !press.png|width=294,height=581!
fields.summary: Improvement of German Translation of The New JIRA Experience

Issue details does not load for business boards if description field is hidden

h3. Environment
* JIRA Core

# Create a business project and add issues
# On the field configuration used by the project, hide the field 'Description'
# Open the project board
# Click on a issue

Issue details are loaded

*

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JQL searches are inconsistent when the username is entirely numeric.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create one user, and set its username as a number - For example, *010101*
#  Assign some issues to this recently created user
# Go to Issue Search and try to search for issues  belonging to this user - {{assignee = 010101}}

h3. Expected Results
There are two possible results for this in a healthy scenario and that makes the search inconsistent:
- The query will auto-complete surrounding the username with quotes - *{{assignee = "010101"}}* and it will return the results;
- The query will return the correct results even without quoting the username.

h3. Actual Results
There are three possible results:
- The search will return no results:
!no-results.png|thumbnail! 
- The search will throw a warning saying the value does not exist:
!value-id-does-not-exist.png|thumbnail! 
- Results are correctly displayed.
 
h3. Notes
- This was tested on different instances, and even in the same version the behavior may differ, as it is depicted in the *Expected Results* section.
- This will also affect filters or dashboards

h3.Workaround
- If the search return no results, manually add quotes *" "* on the numeric username to retrieve results.
fields.summary: JQL searches are inconsistent when the username is entirely numeric

JIRA Issue Calendar gadget shows below error when the system language is set to Deutsch:

September An error occurred whilst rendering this message. Please contact the administrators, and inform them of this bug. Details: ------- org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getText' in class com.atlassian.jira.i18n.BackingI18n threw exception java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: unknown format type: Datum at templates/plugins/jira/portlets/calendar/calendar.vm[line 65, column 88] at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.handleInvocationException(ASTMethod.java:337) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.execute(ASTMethod.java:284) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.execute(ASTReference.java:262) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.render(ASTReference.java:342) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTBlock.render(ASTBlock.java:72) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIfStatement.render(ASTIfStatement.java:87) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.SimpleNode.render(SimpleNode.java:336) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.directive.Parse.render(Parse.java:263) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTDirective.render(ASTDirective.java:175) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.SimpleNode.render(SimpleNode.java:336) at org.apache.velocity.Template.merge(Template.java:328) at org.apache.velocity.Template.merge(Template.java:235) at {code}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Go to *User Profile* 
# Change the Language to *Deutsch (Deutschland)*
# Create an empty dashboard
# Add *JIRA Issue Calendar* gadget
# Configure the filter for the gadget

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the current released of Cloud, there is no option to choose which attachment to download. The only available option is to wither download one by one or download all

h3. Suggested Solution
A checkbox for each attachment uploaded so that it is possible for JIRA user to choose which attachment to download.

h3. Why this is important
It is important to have this feature as it will allow JIRA user to choose which attachments to download and it will be handy when downloading multiple attachment
fields.summary: Option to download selected attachments in JIRA issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using filter, for example, (summary ~ currentUser() OR description ~ currentUser() OR comment ~ currentUser()), it does not return any results.
If we change the currentUser() for the username, it works.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have an issue where your username is included on a comment, description or summary.
# Search for summary ~ currentUser() OR description ~ currentUser() OR comment ~ currentUser()

h3. Expected Results

It returns the results for the current user logged on the instance.

h3. Actual Results

It returns nothing.

h3.Workaround

Change the currentUser() for the username.
fields.summary: Filter to find mentions is not working with currentUser()

fields.description:
Problem:
 * As a person responsible for the delivery of some set of functionality, i need a way to track my release. This includes a release that includes work from multiple projects. 

Experience today:
 # In JIRA Portfolio i can create a "Cross Project Release"
 # This creates separate Releases in each of my projects
 # I create a gadget and specify the release, FOR EACH PROJECT.

Ask:
 * Gadget that looks at all the release data and not just per individual project.

Today there is no view to track overall how the project is going, instead i have to look at N number of release charts to determine if we are on track as a whole. i am able to "align" dates across the projects. 

Per Jira's recommendation, each project is its own product that can be built and deployed independent of the others. Multiple teams work across the same projects so knowing how we are as a whole tracking vs knowing that teams have been focused on a work on a few projects does not provide enough value.
fields.summary: Release Version Gadget Roll Up

fields.description:
h2. Problem Description

When running import, it hits into the error below:
!Screen Shot 2017-09-28 at 12.00.30 AM.png|thumbnail!

Checking on the logs, you see the error message:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:Issue][summary,SUB TEST 3][watches,1][creator,creator][created,2017-07-31 12:59:53.745][project,10000][reporter,reporter][type,10400][priority,3][resolution,10000][number,12][projectKey,VINCENT][denormalisedSubtaskParent,11300][resolutiondate,2017-08-31 11:40:43.031][votes,0][id,11302][updated,2017-08-31 11:40:43.034][workflowId,11302][status,10001] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.jiraissue (ID, pkey, issuenum, PROJECT, REPORTER, ASSIGNEE, CREATOR, issuetype, SUMMARY, DESCRIPTION, ENVIRONMENT, PRIORITY, RESOLUTION, issuestatus, CREATED, UPDATED, DUEDATE, RESOLUTIONDATE, VOTES, WATCHES, TIMEORIGINALESTIMATE, TIMEESTIMATE, TIMESPENT, WORKFLOW_ID, SECURITY, denormalised_subtask_parent, FIXFOR, COMPONENT) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (ERROR: insert or update on table "jiraissue" violates foreign key constraint "jiraissue_denormalised_subtask_parent_fkey"
  Detail: Key (denormalised_subtask_parent)=(11300) is not present in table "jiraissue".))	
{noformat}

The error seems to be caused by the order of the entities.xml, see example:
{noformat}
    <Issue id="11301" projectKey="VINCENT" number="11" project="10000" reporter="" creator="creator" type="10102" summary="SUB TEST 2" priority="3" status="10000" created="2017-07-31 12:58:29.973" updated="2017-07-31 12:58:29.973" votes="0" watches="1" workflowId="11301" denormalisedSubtaskParent="11300"/>
    <Issue id="11300" projectKey="VINCENT" number="10" project="10000" reporter="" creator="creator" type="10103" summary="JW TEST 2" description="TEST 2" priority="3" status="10000" created="2017-07-31 12:57:42.129" updated="2017-07-31 12:57:42.129" votes="0" watches="1" workflowId="11300"/>
{noformat}

The sample above, failed due to the issue id 11301 contains a column denormalisedSubtaskParent="11300" which referring to the issue that yet to be injected to the database. Therefore causing the error

h2. Steps to replicate
(i) There might not be a reliable way to replicate this issue, as it depends on backup process how it orders the id for issues
# An JIRA Cloud instance with a lot of subtask
# Generate a backup from the instance above
# Attempt to import to another JIRA Cloud instance

h2. Expected Result
Import complete, as the backup data generated from JIRA Cloud to another JIRA Cloud

h2. Actual Result
Import failed as the error message on the problem description

h2. Workaround
You can change the order back to how it should be by editing the entities.xml
fields.summary: JIRA Import Fails during Import Because of Unique Constraint of Subtask

h3. Problem Definition
The ability to create projects with sample data has been lost in the new JIRA Experience.
It's not possible to select this type of project anymore in the templates section.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to create this type of project for the end user.

For now, users can try to revert back to the old UI and create sample projects.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Dropdown menus with scrollbars are collapsing when you click on them.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In the instance, turn on the new Jira experience
# Hit the create issue button
# In any dropdown menu with enough items to display a scrollbar, try to navigate on the options clicking on the scrollbar here's an image as an example:
!Screen Shot 2017-09-27 at 10.43.45.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The scroll works when you click on the scrollbar

h3. Actual Results
The dropdown menu collapses once you click in the scrollbar.
 
h3. Notes
- The problem is occurring specifically with the new Jira layout
- It's not occurring only in the issue creation - while editing issues, the problem is also reproducible.
- Also, the problem is not reproducible on other browsers like Chrome or Firefox.

h3.Workaround
- Use a different browser (Chrome, Firefox)
- Opt out for the new Jira experience and return to the old layout
fields.summary: Menus with scrollbar are collapsing on Internet Explorer

fields.description:
By default all the requests sent to JIRA are dropped if they more than 60 seconds to get a response. 

However this may prevent the rest/api/2/issue/bulk endpoint from working correctly. For example, when trying to bulk create 100 issues, if this takes more than 60 seconds then only 80 are created and the other 20 are lost forever.
fields.summary: It would be nice to have REST requests to the rest/api/2/issue/bulk endpoint handled asynchronously so that they don't hit the proxy timeout of 60 seconds.
The text in a new or highlighted issue comment jumps around when hovered with mouse

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In one of the latest JIRA updates, there was an unexpected change in how Version Picker (multiple version) custom fields display.

Instead of showing a simple button to click and display the version (filtering as characters are entered), a list of versions is shown in Edit Screen for issues (regardless of whether the users started editing this field).

This is not happening in the Create Screen in most cases, but we can see it when editing the issue.

Also something note is that this bug is currently extremely inconvenient when your project have a lot of versions in them (a pretty common scenario) and you have to scroll through a long list of versions to select them. 

h3. Affected Version:

JIRA 1000.1350.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Version Picker (multiple versions) custom field
 # Add it to a project’s Edit and View Screens
 # Create an issue using these screens
 # Edit it

h3. Expected Results

The versions are only listed when the field is selected, just like Fix and Affects Version/s fields.
 * !Fix Version.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results

A permanent list of versions is displayed, taking up space.
 * !Custom Field.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes

Custom fields which were created earlier, show with the "old" design
h3. Workaround

Use *cmd* + *click* to select multiple versions as in:
 * !Custom Field.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Change in Version Picker (multiple version) interface

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
Clicking on a project will set the project as the most recently used project which will be the selected option for project field in create issue page. If you open projects in different tabs and then try to create issue (by choosing Create button) in the tab for any project, the selected project for the project field in create issue page will be set as the most recently used/clicked project.
This can result in creation of issue in wrong project if you don't choose the right project in create issue page.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# From list of projects open a project (say project A) in new tab
# Open another project (say project B) in another tab
# Go to the tab opened in step 1 (for project A) and click on *Create* button from top most navigation bar
# In the create issue screen, project B will be selected for project field (even though you've chosen Create in project A)

h3. Expected results:
For each tab/window, the project field be set as the project which is opened in that tab/window

h3. Actual results:
Most recently used/clicked project will be set for project field in create issue screen for every tab/window
fields.summary: Project field in create issue screen will be set as the most recently used project and not the project in the current tab/window

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it's only possible to create a personal or a group based filter subscription - it's not possible to choose some specific users to add them to the filter subscription.
If you to subscribe certain users on a filter, they must be part of the same group.

h3. Suggested Solution
Expand the functionality in a way to add single users on the filter subscription.

h3. Why this is important
This will help users to manage filter subscriptions - instead create one group to add all the users who should receive the filter subscription, it would be easier to add them individually. 

h3. Workaround 
The users must sign up themselves in order to receive the filter results.
fields.summary: Expand the filter subscription to pick single users
